thread.title: How Claudio Ranieri getting sacked by Leicester ended up with Arsene Wenger getting trolled
thread.title_full: How Claudio Ranieri getting sacked by Leicester ended up with Arsene Wenger getting trolled

author: dwright
title: How Claudio Ranieri getting sacked by Leicester ended up with Arsene Wenger getting trolled
text:
RAN OVER WENGER How Claudio Ranieri getting sacked by Leicester ended up with Arsene Wenger getting trolled 
Shock at departure of Premier League winner leads to more jokes at the expense of under-fire Arsenal boss By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CLAUDIO RANIERI’S sacking by Leicester sparked a furious outcry on social media – that ended up with Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger being trolled. 
Ranieri was given the boot by the Foxes less than 300 days after leading them to the amazing feat of winning the Premier League. PA:Press Association 4 Cl;audio Ranieri has paid the price the poor form of Leicester with his job 
The decision was greeted with dismay by pundits and supporters alike, even though the Foxes are under real threat of being relegated from the top flight. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And those who are on the case of Gunners manager Wenger were quick to poke fun at the Frenchman on Twitter, mocking his failure to win a league title for 13 years. Reuters 4 Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has been criticised by supporters for failing to deliver league titles 
Some pointed out that previous Premier League winning managers Roberto Mancini, Manuel Pellegrini, Jose Mourinho and now Ranieri had all been sacked – while Wenger remained. 
And others poked fun at the Gunners boss, claiming in light of so many title winners being given the boot it was his ploy to finish fourth to keep his job. Premier League winning managers: 
— Chaluva (@chaluva263) February 24, 2017 
But the chorus of disapproval at Ranieri’s treatment was criticised by former Manchester United star Gary Neville. 
The Sky pundit claimed it was hypocritical for those calling for Wenger to be sacked to then blast Leicester for swinging the axe on Ranieri. Same people saying Ranieri sacking is disgusting and a betrayal want another removed from his Job where a board shows the ultimate loyalty! 
— Gary Neville (@GNev2) February 24, 2017 Half-naked man dressed like giraffe invades pitch at Arsenal v Sutton latest football news EUROPA DRAW Manchester United await their fate for Europa League last 16 draw - Schalke, Ajax, Roma in the hat Get Beller-in Arsenal star Hector Bellerin is wanted by Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola this summer in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw?
